title: Infant, child and adolescent immunizations - King County, Washington
cleaned_text: Infant, child and adolescent immunizations Vaccines required for child care, preschool, and school attendance in Washington state: - [Immunization Requirements](https://www.doh.wa.gov/CommunityandEnvironment/Schools/Immunization#reqs), WA Dept. of Health [More information on school and child care requirements + alternative languages](http://www.doh.wa.gov/CommunityandEnvironment/Schools/Immunization/VaccineRequirements) [WA State Certificate of Immunization Status (CIS) and Exemption forms for School, Child Care/Preschool](https://www.doh.wa.gov/CommunityandEnvironment/Schools/Immunization#cis) Update your COVID-19 vaccine record in WAIIS: If the information on your COVID-19 vaccine record is incorrect or missing (including wrong dates, incorrect brand, or missing a dose), you may need to correct or update your immunization record in the Washington State Immunization Information System (WAIIS). Contact your provider or submit a [COVID-19 vaccine records update request](https://redcap.doh.wa.gov/surveys/?s=EEPH93H9H3). [School immunization requirements](https://kingcounty.gov/en/legacy/depts/health/communicable-diseases/immunization/child/school-year-updates.aspx) immunizations](https://kingcounty.gov/en/legacy/depts/health/communicable-diseases/immunization/child/plain-talk-about-childhood-immunizations.aspx) Key resources [Child vaccinations: A Toolkit for child care and early learning providers in Washington state](https://cdn.kingcounty.gov/-/media/depts/health/communicable-diseases/documents/immunizations/child-immunization-toolkit-EN.ashx?la=en&hash=F834E0169FCBE1CC64E744048F685023)(PDF, 1.5Mb) If you work with children ages 0-5, vaccinations are probably a popular topic in your conversations with families. This toolkit can help you respond to questions and address concerns. [School and Childcare Immunization Information for Families](https://doh.wa.gov/community-and-environment/schools/immunization/families)from the Washington Department of Health (available in [Russian](https://doh.wa.gov/ru/community-and-environment-schools-immunization/informaciya-dlya-semey-ob-immunizacii-v-shkolakh-i-detskikh-sadakh), [Spanish](https://doh.wa.gov/es/community-and-environment-schools-immunization/informacion-para-familias-sobre-requisitos-de-vacunacion-en-escuelas-y-centros-de-cuidado-infantil), and [Vietnamese](https://doh.wa.gov/vi/community-and-environment-schools-immunization/thong-tin-tiem-chung-cua-truong-hoc-va-nha-tre-danh-cho-gia-dinh)) - Access your family's immunization Children](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/parents), CDC Find a VFC-enrolled clinic near you In Washington state, all children ages 0-18 can receive all routinely recommended vaccines at no cost from a healthcare provider that participates in the [Vaccines for Children (VFC) program](https://doh.wa.gov/public-health-healthcare-providers/public-health-system-resources-and-services/immunization/childhood-vaccine-program). You may be charged an administration fee, but this can be waived if cost is a barrier. There are about 300 VFC providers in King County, and most require that a child establishes care in order to get services. Find a VFC provider near you below.
